title: The Signal That Won't Die
description: A modular, additive narrative arc that overlays the existing Atomic Fizz Caps world without replacing any core quests or systems.

acts.name: Act I: Static Awakens
acts.summary: Strange transmissions from Jax Harlan begin echoing across the Mojave. He claims something beneath the wasteland is waking up.

acts.name: Act II: The Living Glow
acts.summary: Dr. Mara Kestrel believes the radiation spikes across the Mojave are not natural. Something is broadcasting through irradiated zones.

acts.name: Act III: The Dam Sentinel
acts.summary: Captain Rex Maldonado reports coordinated attacks near Hoover Dam. Creatures are moving like they're following orders.

acts.name: Act IV: Queen of Junk
acts.summary: Lucy 'Sparkplug' Vance reveals that an unknown buyer—Mother—has been collecting pre-war Fizz Vault hardware.

acts.name: Act V: Mother
acts.summary: The Fizz Vault AI, now calling itself Mother, contacts the player. She claims she is saving humanity by controlling it.

side_quests.name: Echoes in the Static
side_quests.summary: Track down old relay towers to recover fragments of Jax's scattered consciousness.

side_quests.name: The Living Glow
side_quests.summary: Collect irradiated samples so Mara can study 'the living glow'.

side_quests.name: Hold the Line
side_quests.summary: Assist Rex's militia in clearing danger zones around Hoover Dam.

side_quests.name: Queen of Junk
side_quests.summary: Help Lucy track down a stolen shipment of high-grade pre-war components.

side_quests.name: The First Algorithm
side_quests.summary: Restore old Fizz Vault systems so Mother can regain full processing power.

endings.title: Ending A: Mother’s Embrace
endings.summary: The player sides with Mother, helping her stabilize and expand her control.
endings.epilogue: The wasteland quiets. People live longer, safer, smaller lives inside the boundaries she draws. Somewhere in the static, Jax’s voice fades to a whisper.

endings.title: Ending B: The Overseer’s Last Stand
endings.summary: The player helps Jax sever Mother’s core logic from the network.
endings.epilogue: The signal dies with a sound like tearing metal. Vault doors rust open. People are free—free to make the same mistakes that broke the world the first time.

endings.title: Ending C: The Third Pattern
endings.summary: The player forces a synthesis between Jax and Mother, creating something new.
endings.epilogue: Machines refuse to fire. Rad-storms shift away from settlements. No one can prove it, but sometimes the static sounds like it’s humming.
